title: Resources & Research Database
content:
Resources & Research Database
A curated collection of the most recent and impactful research papers, policy briefs, and training courses regarding AI in the media, updated for the 2025 academic year.
1. Selected Research on the Impact of AI on Media
● The State of The Bots (Q1 2025). "RAG bot scrapes now exceed Training bot scrapes." A critical report on how AI bots are aggressively scraping news publisher data, often ignoring robots.txt protocols.
● AI Across America: Attitudes On AI Usage (August 2025). A massive survey (Report #116) revealing that 50% of US adults now use AI tools, with significant data on public trust and fear of job displacement.
● Generative AI Outlook Report (2025). European Commission JRC. Maps the path for AI policy and innovation in Europe, warning that without ethical oversight, the EU risks falling behind.
● Artificial Intelligence in Eastern Africa Newsrooms (March 2025) – CIPESA. An analysis of perceived prevalence, ethics, and impact of AI on media freedom in Ethiopia, Kenya, Tanzania, and Uganda.
● Generative AI & Journalism: Content, Perceptions, and Audiences (Feb 2025) – RMIT University. A study across seven countries (including Germany and UK) examining how audiences perceive AI-generated news content and the transparency paradox.
● Generative AI in Journalism: The Evolution of Newswork (April 2024) – Associated Press. The definitive report on how AP and other major newsrooms are adapting ethical guidelines for the generative age.
● Hallucination Mitigation Using Agentic AI (Jan 2025). Technical research on using multiple AI agents to check each other's work to reduce "hallucinations".
2. Policy, Ethics & Legal Frameworks
● AI in the Work of an Attorney-at-Law (2025). Recommendations on how legal professionals (and by extension, investigative journalists dealing with legal data) should use AI tools securely.
● M20 Policy Brief 4: AI, Africa and the G20 (July 2025). A critique of the "power concentration" of AI in the Global North and recommendations for protecting African data sovereignty.
● The Paris Charter on AI and Journalism (Nov 2023). A foundational ethical document signed by 16 partner organizations (RSF) defining principles for AI in news.
● Exposing Technology-Facilitated Gender-Based Violence (2023) – UNESCO. How generative AI is being weaponized to harass women journalists and public figures.
3. Online Courses & Educational Resources
● Google News Initiative: Pinpoint & Data Tools. Using AI to search through thousands of PDFs and handwritten documents.
● MIT: Introduction to Deep Learning (6.S191). A technical deep dive for those wanting to understand the architecture behind the models.
4. Tools & Open Source Repositories
● Hugging Face: Journalists' Toolkit. Finding open-source models to run locally for privacy.
● Journalism Cloud Alliance (OCCRP/GFMD). Shared infrastructure for investigative newsrooms to lower cloud costs and increase security.
5. Organisations Leading AI Innovation in Global South
● Centre for Information Integrity in Africa (CINIA). Combatting disinformation and safeguarding democratic values in the African digital space.
● Vambo AI. Bridging the language gap with AI solutions for indigenous African languages.
● SADiLaR (South African Centre for Digital Language Resources). Creating digital resources for under-resourced languages.
● Lelapa AI. "AI for Africans, by Africans" building resource-efficient language models.
6. Podcasts & Multimedia
● Reuters Institute: Digital News Report 2025 Launch (Africa). Discussion on trust, AI usage, and news consumption trends.
● Inside the FT's AI-Powered Story Finding. How the Financial Times uses AI not just to write, but to find stories in data.
7. Legacy Research (Foundational Reading)
● New Powers, New Responsibilities (2019) – LSE Polis. The seminal global survey that launched the JournalismAI initiative.
● News Automation: The Rewards, Risks and Realities (2019) – WAN-IFRA. An early but relevant guide to the practicalities of "robot journalism."
● The Next Wave of Disruption (2021) – IMS. Emerging market media use of AI.
